snippet: Via a case from South Carolina, the Supreme Court agreed to address a 1978 federal law underlying the adoption of American Indian children.
abstract: Supreme Court agrees to consider cases concerning adoption of American Indian children and whether federal judges may play a role in plea negotiations; court will address federal Indian Child Welfare Act of 1978, which calls for special procedures rooted in sovereignty of Indian nations and history of abusive child welfare practices involving Indian children.
lead_paragraph: Via a case from South Carolina, the Supreme Court agreed to address a 1978 federal law underlying the adoption of American Indian children.
